description:
...but I'm suspicious of SailFish OS on my Android phone... From what I've heard, they support their own phones and some Sony Xperia, which makes me question is it more likely to work or be totally unusable on my phones (well, was OnePlus N100, but I just got robbed - I wanted a Nokia, but was in hurry to get a new phone when my Nokia 6.1 broke, but now that I lost that OnePlus, I can get back to enjoying Nokia phones, with vanilla Android - I might hate Android, but much less when it has no modifications from manufacturer. If I only could know for sure if SailFish had support for me phone, I'd love to have it...

Maybe, if there's a virtualization system to run SailFish OS on top of Linux, I could use it on my Lenovo X1 Tablet (really a laptoo/tablet hybrid, but the screen is detachable with all the hardware inside the tablet, except some extra ports on keyboard part.

im a very very very beginner to ubuntu like i want to learn because i litterly dont even know how to run a single command in terminal so can someone please point me in the right dirrection to start learning all the basics and fundumentals of this stuff i want to eventualy have to use a computer and all this cool coding and stuff for work....... but lol i dont even know what kind of job that would even be lol

I been using to flash some androids versions, surelly if you need to compile in github some of the non listed and contents not included on this useful app.. I recommend for users and developers who easly can apport more supported templates to easy use for those who are working like me, flashing Androids and tablets. The challenge is easy, just give to the open sources programming scrips all that you been get on your experienced time that you spending in all your one's use made scripts and supported patches that you know it will works to others less experienced Linux users.
